intro: Pavonia urens var. lingua, commonly known as the scarlet flamebush, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, bright red or orange bracts that surround small, yellowish flowers. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil. The species is often used in ornamental gardening due to its vibrant color and drought tolerance.
